text: parallel pre-compiling DataFrames.jl on 1.6 from scratch takes less system resources than loading the slack browser tab

text: This could be a fun game... "how many things can I do in julia while using fewer resources than slack"

text: at this point I'm not sure I'd even be particularly surprised if slack is trying to use my browser to mine cryptocurrencies

text: the internet is a pretty appaling thing when you really get down into it... Electron just sucks the life out of even modern computers. Why? Because no one ever really figured out sane solutions to front ends, instead they just keep gluing front ends ontop of front ends ontop of things that were kinda made for front ends but not really they were kinda made in like 10 days despite technologies existing for decades that could have been used *cough JS cough*
